scheme_name: U-Pb Concordia QC and Common Pb Screening
author: Sefy Levy
description: Screen zircon U-Pb data for concordance, common Pb, and analytical reliability
reference: Ludwig, K.R. (2003). User's Manual for Isoplot 3.00. Berkeley Geochronology Center. / Spencer, C.J., et al. (2016). Strategies towards robust interpretations of in situ zircon U-Pb geochronology.

classifications.name: CONCORDANT (<5% DISCORDANCE)
classifications.description: 206Pb/238U and 207Pb/206Pb ages agree within 5%; reliable crystallization age

classifications.name: NEARLY CONCORDANT (5–10% DISCORDANCE)
classifications.description: Mild Pb loss; use with caution

classifications.name: DISCORDANT (>10% DISCORDANCE)
classifications.description: Significant Pb loss; unreliable for geochronology

classifications.name: REVERSELY DISCORDANT
classifications.description: 206Pb/238U age > 207Pb/206Pb age; analytical artifact or inheritance

classifications.name: HIGH COMMON PB (Pb_c > 1%)
classifications.description: Significant common Pb contamination; unreliable ages

classifications.name: LOW COMMON PB (Pb_c < 0.5%)
classifications.description: Minimal common Pb; suitable for analysis

classifications.name: HIGH PB LOSS / RADIOGENIC PB
classifications.description: Low 206Pb/204Pb (<500) indicates possible Pb loss or common Pb

classifications.name: HIGH URANIUM (>2000 ppm)
classifications.description: High U content may cause metamictization and Pb loss

classifications.name: INSUFFICIENT GEOCHRONOLOGY DATA
classifications.description: Missing isotopic ages, common Pb, or U concentration
